title: Important Notice: Zoom-Only Liturgy This Sunday, January 25
body:
Due to the major snowstorm expected to impact the New York City region this Sunday, our liturgy will be held virtually on Zoom only. No one will be present at St. John's.

Our liturgy will begin at the usual time, 6:30 PM Eastern. A worship aid with full information will be sent in advance.

title: There is Still Time to Contribute to the Dignity/New York Advent Appeal
body:
November 2025

Dear Members and Friends of Dignity/New York,

title: Join us Tonight for the Liturgy for the Feast of the Holy Family at 6:30 pm
Christmas Eve Liturgy at 6:30 pm
Join Us This Sunday for First Sunday of Advent!
See the Film: Taking a Chance on God
body: Screening hosted by the Curran Center for American Catholic Studies in partnership with Theology and Women, Gender and Sexuality Studies. Monday, October 6, 2025 at 6:00 p.m. at McNally Amphitheatre, 140 West 62nd Street, Fordham University Lincoln Center Campus. Free and Open to the Public. Registration is Required.

title: Election Results for Steering Committee
body: Four individuals were elected for a two-year term starting November 1, 2025: James O., Jeff S., Nick C., and Robert B. They join continuing members Chris A., Danny L., and Lewis S., whose terms conclude October 31, 2026.

title: Ballots for the Steering Committee Have Been Sent Out
body: The Elections Committee distributed ballots to members on September 13. Members who haven't voted will receive up to three reminders. Those missing ballots should contact elections@dignityny.org.

title: Steering Committee Nominations Now Open!
body: Nominations remain open until the Candidates' Forum on September 10, 2025. A nomination petition is available electronically and in print.

title: Join us this Saturday for Our Pride Liturgy and Social!
body: Announcement for an upcoming pride-themed liturgy and social gathering.

title: 2025 Pride Appeal
Celebrating Pride with Dignity/New York
body: Our Pride Liturgy will be on June 28th in St. John's in the Village Church, 218 West 11th St at NEW TIME - 3PM. Empanadas reception with choice of Chicken, beef, vegetable and portobello mushroom options plus refreshments and dessert in the garden afterward.

title: Congratulations to Pope Leo XIV
body: The organization expresses hope that the new Pope will advance Pope Francis's work. No Pope is perfect nor anyone is perfect. We remain committed to our mission for equality and diversity while working against discrimination.

title: Join Us this Easter Season!
body: Join us for Eucharistic liturgy at 6:30 pm or remotely via Zoom during Easter season, running from Easter Sunday (4/20) through Pentecost (6/8).

title: Ash Wednesday - March 5, 2025
body: Online-only service at 6:00 pm on March 5, 2025, plus Lenten Evening Prayer on March 13 at 7:30 pm via Zoom.

title: Chapter's Steering Committee Nominations Are Now Open
body: 2024 ELECTIONS NOTICE: The members of Dignity/NY are invited to participate in the annual election of the Steering Committee of Dignity/NY, the governing body of Dignity/NY, pursuant to the bylaws of this Chapter and vote for candidates standing for election to the Steering Committee.

title: Celebrate Pride 2024 with Dignity/New York
body: Theme for 2024 March Down Fifth Avenue is "Reflect. Empower." Pride Liturgy scheduled for Saturday, June 29, 2024 at 6:30 pm in St. John's in the Village Church, 218 West 11th St., 10014. Sean Collins serving as homilist and co-presider, followed by gala reception.

title: March 8, 2024 International Women's Day
body: IWD isn't country, group or organization specific. It's a day of collective global activism and celebration that belongs to all those committed to forging women's equality.

title: March with Dignity/New York this Sunday, March 3, 2024
body: Organization marching in 25th Anniversary St. Pat's For All Parade, meeting at 43rd Street & Skillman Avenue, Queens 12pm for speeches and 1 pm parade kickoff.

title: Call to Action
body: May Nex Benedict rest in peace. May their family find comfort. May we never forget! No one should be bullied. We need to protect our transgender and gender fluid youth.

title: DignityUSA Speaks Out After Cecilia Gentili's Funeral at St. Patrick's
body: DignityUSA Executive Director Marianne Duddy-Burke discusses the archdiocese's response to the funeral, expressing skepticism about their claims regarding the event.

title: Journey with DignityNY this Lent
body: The organization offers Ash Wednesday ashes for remote participants and an accompanying Little Black Book for Lent. Materials available for mailing or in-person pickup through February 6, 2024.

title: Epiphany Proclamation 2024
body: The historical practice of proclaiming liturgical calendar dates on Epiphany Sunday and how Easter's moveable date affects the church year.

title: We Celebrate Epiphany! Epiphany Home Blessing & Marking the Lintel
body: A prayer for blessing chalk and guidance for an Epiphany home blessing ritual.

title: Vatican Saying Same-Sex Couples can be Blessed "a Key Step Forward" says DignityUSA
body: DignityUSA celebrates the Vatican's December 2023 announcement permitting priests to bless same-sex couples as recognition that these relationships can be holy.

title: Pride Weekend Details
body: Saturday, June 24, 2023, 6:30 pm Dignity/New York Pride Liturgy at St. John's in the Village Episcopal Church, 218 West 11th St, West Village 10014.

title: Pride Appeal
body: Happy Pride! As we look back over the past year, we have much to be proud of, from our 50th anniversary celebrations to our progressive, inclusive liturgies.

title: Dignity/New York Marches in Queens Pride Parade 2023
body: Celebrate Queens Pride on Sunday June 4th at 12pm as we parade down 37th Avenue in Jackson Heights, followed by a multicultural festival.

title: Members of Dignity/New York going to the screening of Let's Kiss
body: Documentary screening Mon, 04/17/2023 - 6:30pm at Casa Italiana NYU. "Let's Kiss Franco Grillini - History of a Gentle Revolution."

title: Happy Easter!
body: Christ Has Risen! Dignity/New York will celebrate Easter Sunday Liturgy at 6:30 pm on April 9, 2023.

title: Transgender Day of Visibility 2023
body: The NYS Senate will be voting on S2475A Relates to certain prohibitions regarding the legal system and gender-affirming care.

title: St. Pat's For All Parade - March 5, 2023
body: Each year, members of Dignity/New York have marched in the St. Pat's for All Parade, which goes from Sunnyside to Woodside, Queens.

title: Ash Wednesday Service on Zoom February 22, 2023 7:30 pm
body: May your Lenten season be prayerful. Join us via Zoom for our annual Ash Wednesday Service.

title: Epiphany Chalk and Home Blessing 2023
body: A prayer for blessing chalk and details about an Epiphany home blessing ritual.

title: Christmas Eve and New Year's Day Liturgies
body: Join us for Christmas Eve Liturgy at 6:30 pm (December 24, 2022) at St. John's in the Village Church, 218 West 11th St.

title: Advent Appeal
body: Once again, we are approaching the prayerful season of Advent and the beginning of a new liturgical year. We just concluded our 50th anniversary year with a wonderful dinner and liturgy.

title: Dignity/New York Honors Transgender Day of Remembrance
body: The organization honored Transgender Day of Remembrance during a weekly liturgy at St. John's in the Village Church, 218 West 11th St., New York, NY at 6:30 pm.

title: Celebrating 50 Years
body: Join us on Sunday to celebrate our 50 years of ministry.

title: 2022 Elections Notice and Petition of Nomination
DignityNY Receives the DignityUSA President's Award
body: The community received an award at the DignityUSA 25th Conference in San Diego, CA (July 8-10, 2022).

title: Celebrate NYC Pride Weekend With Dignity/New York
body: Saturday, June 25, 2022, 6:30 pm - Pride Liturgy and BBQ Social following liturgy at St. John's in the Village Church and broadcast on Zoom.

title: Contribute to the Annual Pride Appeal
body: Happy Birthday to us! In 2022, we celebrate the 50th anniversary of our community. In this Pride season, we certainly have much to be proud of: 50 years of support, worship, and witness.

title: Celebrating Pride & Our 50th Anniversary
body: To mark our 50th anniversary, we are planning many special events throughout 2022, starting with a picnic after our liturgy on Pentecost Sunday, June 5th.

title: Easter Sunday Liturgy
body: Dignity/New York will celebrate Easter Sunday liturgy at 6:30 pm ET at St. John's in the Village Episcopal Church.

title: Good Friday Service
body: Dignity/New York will celebrate its Good Friday Service at 6:30 pm ET on Zoom through the regular Sunday evening Zoom link.

title: Epiphany Proclamation 2022
body: How Easter's moveable date affects the liturgical calendar and the ancient tradition of proclaiming upcoming dates on Epiphany Sunday.

title: World AIDS Day - December 1, 2021
body: Marking 40 years of Dignity/New York's work addressing AIDS. We ask you to look with favor on our siblings and friends, all over the world who have suffered and died of AIDS.

title: Dignity/New York Advent Appeal 2021
body: Reflecting on returning to in-person liturgies at St. John's in June after 15+ months away, continuing to joyfully celebrate who we are as LGBTQ+ Catholics and allies.

title: Dignity/New York Nominations, Candidates Forum and Elections
body: Five open Steering Committee positions with nominations open until September 16, 2021, requiring support from ten enrolled members.

title: Zoom Only Liturgy Tonight - August 22, 2021
body: Zoom-only services due to heavy expected rainfall.

title: News From the Steering Committee
body: The Steering Committee met via Zoom on July 13 and August 3. Due to the changing health situation, face coverings are once again required for ALL in the church at St. John's.

title: Updated Protocols for Attending Liturgy at St. John's effective August 5, 2021
body: Due to the changing health situation, face coverings are once again required for ALL in the church at St. John's. They are optional outside, such as in the courtyard.

title: IMPORTANT CHANGES REGARDING ATTENDANCE AT ST JOHN'S - July 13, 2021
body: Fr. Graeme, Rector at St. John's, has recently advised us of changes in the safety protocols at St. John's, which we are obliged to follow. Reservations are no longer necessary.

title: Return to St. John's - Reserve Your Seat
body: Capacity in the church is currently limited to 40 people in the pews. Details about our return to St. John's on June 20.

title: Dignity/New York Pride Appeal 2021
Return to St. John's on Sunday, June 20, 2021
body: After fifteen months away, we will be returning to St. John's for in-person liturgies. We will resume our regular weekly schedule on Sunday, June 20, at 6:30 PM.

title: Easter Day Witness at St. Patrick's Cathedral
body: A demonstration at the cathedral on Easter morning protested a Vatican statement opposing blessings for same-sex unions. The event featured icons honoring out gay priests John McNeill and Mychal Judge, plus a rainbow banner.

title: Dignity/New York's Online Sunday Liturgies
body: Please join us for our online liturgy each Sunday at 6:30 PM (Eastern time) as we gather for worship. The community welcomed participants from multiple countries.

title: Participate in the DignityUSA Townhall - Responding to the Responsum
body: A Vatican statement declared the Church cannot bless same-sex unions, prompting a townhall discussion on March 24th across multiple time zones via Zoom.

title: Local Media Coverage Over Same Sex Blessing Ban Vatican Wants to Impose
body: Over 25 media outlets covered the organization's response to the Vatican announcement, with local representation from multiple news sources.

title: Vatican Statement Denying Blessings to Same-Sex Couples "Exacerbates Pain and Anger" for Gay Catholics says DignityUSA
body: DignityUSA expresses deep disappointment over the Vatican's statement denying blessings to same-sex couples, characterizing it as pastorally harmful and likely to widen the wedge between Catholics and church leadership.

title: Transformed by Love...
body: An invitation to join during Lent for prayer and reflection on transformation.

title: Red Masquerade Ball
body: Mardi Gras-themed celebration featuring costumes, sing-along with accompaniment, food and drinks. Saturday, February 15th at 7 PM at Revelation Gallery, St. John in the Village. Free admission with appreciated reservations.

title: Epiphany Proclamation 2020
Christmas Eve Liturgy
body: December 24th at 6:00 PM at regular Sunday location.

title: Gaudete Sunday December 15th
body: Join us for our Gaudete Sunday Liturgy followed by a festive Pizza Party. December 15, 2019 at 6:30 PM at St. John's in the Village Church.

title: World AIDS Day 2019 Ending the HIV/AIDS Epidemic: Community by Community
body: World AIDS Day (December 1) is a time to remember those we've lost to HIV/AIDS and celebrate progress in treating those living with HIV.

title: Come To The Table announces "Evening Prayer at Home"
body: Catholic worship celebrated in over 25 HouseChurch communities and at the LGBT Center on the 3rd Sunday of the month.

title: Celebrate the Spirit of Stonewall 50 with Dignity/New York
body: June 29 liturgy and social at St. John's in the Village, followed by a free picnic supper in the beautiful courtyard.

title: Dignity/New York celebrates Stonewall 50
body: Join us for free, fascinating and inspiring films, talks, and discussions about faith, activism, and LGBTQI history.

title: Pope Francis Again Demonstrates Dangerous Ignorance About Gay Sexuality
body: DignityUSA expressed concern about Pope Francis' new book, stating it reveals profound ignorance of human sexuality and perpetuates myths about LGBTQI people.

title: Equal Future 2018
body: DignityUSA sponsors Equal Future 2018, an international campaign raising awareness about damage done to children when being LGBT is presented as a misfortune. Many members attended the World Meeting of Families 2018 representing LGBTQI families.

title: Pride 2018
body: Dignity/New York spent thirty minutes in witness at St. Patrick's Cathedral before the NYC Pride Parade, a practice continued since 1987.

title: Dignity/New York celebrates 46 years of Pride!
LGBTQI Catholics Respond to Masterpiece Cake Ruling
Pope Francis' Words to Gay Survivor of Sexual Abuse Have Dogma-Transforming Ramifications
Father Gary 5 years ago
"TAKING STOCK TODAY," Part Two of preparations for DignityUSA's Jubilee 50th anniversary in 2019
body: Join us on Sunday, June 10, 4:00 to 5:30 PM at St. John's in the Village for "Taking Stock Today" discussion followed by sandwiches, salads, soft drinks, and dessert before liturgy.

title: Welcome to our newly designed website
body: We are excited that we have a new website design! We hope this change gives a more modern look and makes finding information easy and efficient.

title: Francis After Five: a Feminist Review
body: Join women theologians, journalists, and ministers for this discussion.

title: Prayer for Transgender Justice
body: Loving Creator, Let the rain come and wash away the ancient grudges, the bitter hatreds held and nurtured over generations. Let the rain wash away the memory of the heart, and neglect. Then Oh God, let the sun come out and fill the sky with beautiful rainbows.
